title: Breaking Bad bosses never wanted Aaron Paul for Jesse Pinkman
text:
Aaron Paul almost missed out on the now-iconic role of Jesse Pinkman in Breaking Bad (Picture: Getty/AMC)

Aaron Paul has revealed that he almost missed out on the now-iconic role of Jesse Pinkman in Breaking Bad.

The role changed Paul’s career forever but the actor has now admitted that the decision by showrunner Vince Gilligan to hire him went against the wishes of everyone else involved in the show.

‘No one wanted me – even after I tested, no one wanted me as the guy, and Vince said, “no, he’s the guy – he has to be the guy”,’ said Paul.

‘Vince played his trump card and said, “I’m not doing the show unless he’s the guy.” So, they were like, “Alright!”‘

Speaking to The Independent, he added: ‘I got to tell you, man, I’m the first to admit how lucky I am.

‘But it’s Vince Gilligan who gave me a chance when, quite frankly, no one else would.

‘I’ve had a lot of ups and downs and at the lowest point of my career, I wasn’t able to pay my bills. I was borrowing money. I thought, “What am I going to do?” Then Vince Gilligan hired me.

El Camino is full of surprises (Picture: Netflix via AP)

Paul played Jesse Pinkman for all five seasons of the hit drama Breaking Bad and is the star of the new spin-off movie, El Camino.

The Netflix movie, which picked up directly after the show’s final fifth season, saw Jesse flee to Alaska for a new life after avoiding the pursuits of law enforcement.

But it turns out Paul predicted Jesse’s outcome three years ago.

Yep, in a Reddit post from three years ago shared by Netflix UK’s official Twitter account, the actor predicted Jesse’s fate weirdly accurately, way before creator Vince Gilligan put pen to paper.

In the Reddit post, Aaron wrote: ‘I’d like to think Jesse got away. I like to think he kept driving. But we all know he has no money, he gave it all away, and we also know his fingerprints are all over everything where Walt was found dead.

‘They’re gonna be searching high and low for Jesse, so I don’t know. I like to think he was building something in Alaska… but he could be locked away in a prison somewhere. But we don’t like to think about that version of the show. So, I think he’s living happy on a lake somewhere in Alaska, fishing a lot, making things out of wood, probably kicked the habit of meth.’

El Camino: A Breaking Bad movie is available now on Netflix.
